Recycled Materials: One idea for building a house without natural materials would be to use recycled materials. This could include reusing old shipping containers, discarded tires, or even old CDs. These materials can be transformed into a variety of building blocks, such as insulation, roofing, and even structural beams.

3D Printing: Another idea would be to use 3D printing technology to create a house. With 3D printing, you can create custom-made building blocks that can be assembled together to create a strong and durable structure. This technology also allows for a lot of flexibility in terms of design, so you can create a house that is both functional and visually appealing.
Bamboo: Bamboo is a fast-growing and renewable resource that can be used as a substitute for wood. It is strong, lightweight, and easy to work with, making it a great option for building a house.

Recycled Paper: Recycled paper can be used to create a variety of building materials, such as insulation, roofing, and even flooring. This material is renewable, biodegradable, and can be sourced locally, making it a great option for eco-friendly building.

Ferrocement: Ferrocement is a building material made from cement and iron, and can be used to create a variety of structures, including houses. It is strong, durable, and can be easily molded into different shapes and sizes, making it a versatile and practical option for building a house.
